tmortagne - (10:18): CalebJamesDeLisl: "Div macro" that's exactly what is group syntax for already (even better since it's a syntax and not a black box macro)  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:32): "group syntax"?   like (%class="something"%)html(%%) ?  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:32): s/html/wiki  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:33): Or are you talking about this ((( some content )))  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:33): ?  
tmortagne - (10:35): yes (((  
tmortagne - (10:35): (%class="something"%)html(%%) is not a group  
tmortagne - (10:36): it's a FormatBlock  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:36): So there is a way to apply attributes to the group?  
tmortagne - (10:36): yep like for any other block  
tmortagne - (10:36): (%param=value%)(((  
tmortagne - (10:36): it's working the same that tables, list, etc...  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:37): Hmm. Maybe I didn't read the syntax page carefully enough but I totally missed that.  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:37): So ((( = div?  
tmortagne - (10:38): I just looked and there is no explicit example for the group syntax but i guess it's because all syntaxes support custom parameters except macros  
tmortagne - (10:38): CalebJamesDeLisl: yes (( = div in xhtml renderer  
tmortagne - (10:38): in rendering it's a "group of standalone elements"  
tmortagne - (10:38): pretty much the same definition than a div  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:39): Well that makes things easier. I have a bunch of code to fix now.  
tmortagne - (10:39): http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Main/XWikiSyntax#HGroups  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:40): I saw that, I never knew that it made a div and I could apply attributes to it though.  
tmortagne - (10:40): the explanation is too much about  table and list  
tmortagne - (10:40): yep it's a bit poor  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:42): Well I will remove my {{div}} macro then.  
mariusbutuc joined #xwiki at 10:44  
tmortagne - (10:44): anyway good thing to track all use case where we are using html amcro that we could translate into something more generic  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:45): Maybe we should have the syntax page on xwiki.org be a regular page (not autoloaded from svn) so we can work on it then commit from time to time.  
tmortagne - (10:47): well at least this way it force us to have an updated syntax page in XE but i agree it's a pain to update it  
silviar left #xwiki at 10:47

tmortagne - (10:49): problem is to keep this Drafts.XWikiSyntax sync with svn when someone directly fix in svn  
CalebJamesDeLisl - (10:50): Good point.

lucaa - (15:00): guys, how can I get the name of the current document in a panel in an xwiki 2.0? because $doc will point to the panel document  
silviar left at 15:07 (Quit: Leaving.  
jvelociter joined #xwiki at 15:22  
tmortagne - (15:22): lucaa: no AFAIK $doc always point to the current document not the panel document (in fact there is no way real standard way to get the panel document)  
lucaa - (15:23): tmortagne: yes, I knew the same... extra testing, wait a second  
abusenius - (15:27): hello @all  
lucaa - (15:27): tmortagne:  yes, it is the including document. Thanks for the confirmation  
tmortagne - (15:27): lucaa: np  
abusenius - (15:28): what is the currently best way to access a component from velocity?  
abusenius - (15:28): VelocityBridge? VelocityContextInitializer? is it documented somewhere?  
tmortagne - (15:28): ScriptService  
tmortagne - (15:29): your componeneet has to provide a ScriptService  
tmortagne - (15:29): let me see for the doc  
tmortagne - (15:30): don't think there is anything actually  
tmortagne - (15:30): should probably be in http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/ComponentModule  
tmortagne - (15:31): when you implement a ScriptService you are automatically "injected" in $services.myservicerolehint  
jvelociter - (15:31): VelocityContextInitializer should not be used anymore  
jvelociter - (15:31): they should all be replaced by ScriptService in fact  
tmortagne - (15:31): yep or for other kind of uses cases  
abusenius - (15:32): hm, Modules/ComponentModule refers to the tutorial, and the tutorial says its outdated :)  
abusenius - (15:32): are there already other components that use ScriptService?  
tmortagne - (15:32): abusenius: you have pretty much everything in http://code.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Modules/ComponentModule except ScriptService and ye sthe tuto is very outdated  
tmortagne - (15:32): abusenius: yes there is some  
tmortagne - (15:33): in rendering for example  
tmortagne - (15:33): let me find it  
abusenius - (15:33): core/xwiki-rendering/xwiki-rendering-xwiki/src/main/java/org/xwiki/rendering/internal/scripting/RenderingScriptService.java  
tmortagne - (15:33): RenderingScriptService and ModelScriptService  
abusenius - (15:34): ok, thx  
tmortagne - (15:34): ScriptService is inject publicly so take care of what you expose
